summary: The bill, titled the "Prying Into Chinese Tyrants' Unreported Riches, Earnings, and Secrets Act" (PICTURES Act), mandates the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to produce a public report on the wealth of the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) leadership. The report will assess their financial holdings, business interests, and assets, including those of their immediate family members. It will include photographic evidence and identify financial proxies.  The DNI must also assess the intelligence community's cooperation in preparing the report. The report must be submitted to Congress and posted publicly (in unclassified form).
